definition: The quality of being easily understood, achieved through precise language, logical structure, and appropriate complexity

positive_examples: Clarity requires choosing the precise word rather than the fancy one.
Structural clarity: topic sentences announce what paragraphs will discuss.
Eliminating unnecessary jargon improves clarity for general audiences.
Clear prose: active voice, concrete nouns, and explicit connections between ideas.
training_hints.disambiguation: Active pursuit of understandability through specific techniques, not just being understood
